The white text on the button here is too low contrast — I think it's supposed to be black?

Anyone want to fix this? Should be pretty simple.

.
Oh, hmm, it's like that in light mode as well. IMO it should be changed in both.

is it surely supposed to be black ?

If that is the case, i would like to fix it out. :smile: (if someone can confirm.)

Thinking about it more, I'm not sure — it'd be awkward to have it be black, since there's white text right next to it. But it's not good as it is. I'm curious what other folks think. (maybe this thread should be moved to #design?)

@Jai soni in your last screenshot there, the message text ("You are sending a message…") looks pretty faint against its background, to my eyes.

Are you using Google Chrome? The color picker in Chrome DevTools has a built-in tool that tells you if text contrast meets minimum or enhanced content-accessibility guidelines. If you want, you can follow links from that doc to what those guidelines are and why they exist—basically, people's eyes differ. :smile: It's also true that people's displays, and their display settings, differ. I use two displays, and the text looks much fainter on one than the other.

I think other browsers' dev tools probably have similar features too?
I add that case to the list of things to cover in the new compose box. In the current design I suggest to make bg color of the button and container darker for the dark theme: image.png
